text:
CO2 at 0.04% is a 2,500th of the atmosphere. That means to warm the climate by just 1"C carbon dioxide molecules must capture 2500"C of heat energy. That is bonkers. It also breaks all the laws of thermodynamics.¬†

Methane is 0.00017% of the atmosphere so its even more bonkers.

However, the climate is changing. This is because of deliberate geoengineering programmes, in particular ozone thinning away from the poles. Though largely unreported ozone thinning effect is directly observable, this summer you will see a unnaturally bright sun just as we did last year. Under these conditions the pain felt when looking at the sun is not only from the increase in visible light but the much larger increase in infrared.¬†(Look up at the sky and you will see a range of geoengineering operations in progress, these include chemtrail induced cloud or hazing, ripple patterns caused by HAARP installations, bizarre and unnatural cloud formations). 

Climate change is a programme to force change in accordance with the implementation of Agenda 21 /2030. Current events demonstrate this transition is well underway and will involve massive population cull through injected nanotech (re transhumanist programme). Agenda 21 also sees the permanent loss of all property rights with the introduction of universal basic income (ref NESARA/GESARA) and has/is being promoted by The World Economic Forum.¬†

'You will own nothing and you will be happy' WEF

In a depopulated world the surviving brainwashed and controlled population will be confined to mega cities. Carbon limits will be used to restrict consumption and liberty. Meanwhile the re-greened wilderness will be the exclusive playground of the ultra rich elite posing as conservationists.¬†

The CO2 hoax amounts to the theft of the world and the enslavement of humanity by a parasitic few.¬†

Welcome to the future!

_______

I have included a debunking of 'accumulated heat' as it is so often used to explain how trace elements, so called 'greenhouse gasses', can warm the planet. 

Accumulated heat whilst sounding a reasonable explanation of how heat can build up is rather nothing more than gobbledygook. In fact it shows those using such arguments do not even understand what heat is. 

When we measure temperature we are measuring the heat energy a thing is losing. In short heat is a measurement of flow, the transfer of heat energy and this will always be in the direction towards the colder. For this reason a thing can never 'accumulate heat' in the way those advocating CO2 climate change describe. The temperature of a body is the measure of heat output, it can never be greater than the measure of heat input. Output = input. When a thing is warmed it is heated to an equivalent of the heat input. If this input is not maintained it will cool. Those that propose that heat can build up to be hotter than the total measure of heat input at a given time either do not understand what heat is or are being deliberately misleading. To illustrate, an object being heated by a flame can never become hotter than that flame, it's temperature cannot rise inexorably to the temperature of the sun for instance. Heat cannot be accumulated. When we think about it common sense tells us this must be the case. 

NASA and even Nobel Prize winning physicists have expounded 'accumulated heat' as the explanation how CO2 is able to warm the atmosphere. They claim that over hundreds of years CO2 has captured heat energy and this heat has 'accumulated' to produce a serious warming effect. As I have just explained, this is totally impossible and fundamentally violates all the laws of thermodynamics. That respected scientists should support such uneducated, unthinking nonsense is disturbing and only reflects that in terms of being able to think clearly about a subject they have no facility or inclination. These are the Dark Ages of science. Belief has outweighed logic or any critical thought. It tells us that we should not unquestioningly accept anything we are told, that experts can be fools. 

(NB: be aware of attempts to discard thermodynamics by talking about biology. 
Eg. 'It only takes a drop of arsenic to kill a person.'
This would be somewhat desperate, muddled thinking. Clearly biological processes based on the reaction of a cell are not the same as the laws of physics/thermodynamics).

text:
If we want to effectively tackle these problems, what we need is to focus only on measures that have a real impact

1) distance tax: a tax that increases the longer the goods are shipped or transported- this incentivizes a local economy and stops the mess of goods running around the world for no reason.

2) female education- the more educated the less children they will have, as overpopulation is a huge problem

3) tackle income inequality- tax the super wealthy and the multinationals, make them pay the right share, no more tax avoidance or producing in countries with lower regulations. Big companies need the most resources and make up the biggest polluters, so local and smaller is better.

4) universal basic income so people dont have "to make a living" at any cost and follow their passions- no damaging, stupid or unnecessary work

5) make hemp biodiesel (and other biodiesels) make up 30% of all fuel compulsory in the economy and make investments. Tackle food waste and make it maximal 5% of all produced. Go towards 0% fossil fuels with improved technology. Swap most plastics for hemp-derived materials

6) sustainability index- make an index of the worst environmental offender-practices. Ban those that are not needed and bring within limits those that can be made sustainable. Use taxes to incentivize/disincentivize

7) go towards a bio-adapted infrastructure such as passages for the wild under highways and so forth. Go back to natural farming, drop all intensive farming, is healthier anyway. Decrease production of animal products. Abandon chemicals, fertilizers and pesticides, all not sustainable.¬†

8) we need a working UN back in some form, to protect areas such as the amazonas and other strategically important parts of the world for the ecology. Besides that we need first nation countries to invest in countries that are lagging behind, as the investment would yield much greater results. This is a global challenge.

9) drop all the measures that wont make any difference and accept that we cant control it 100% at this point. Maybe there are some benefits in a warmer climate too.

text:
I lived in Jakarta '93-'97 and can sincerely say that they, and people in all South East Asian countries, are some of the friendliest in the world. I've traveled in all these countries and worked in 5 of them. 

On my 2nd day in Jakarta, I was asked to put into good English, a document which was to be read at some International event. The gist of it was that the Dayak people of Kalimantan were to be labelled "forest squatters" and were to be evicted. It was so that Bob Hassan, the biggest logger in Indonesia could cut the whole place down. This explains the mudslides and probably much more.

Love to all peoples in my beloved Indonesia.

text:
¬†@odinson43¬† Any more idiotic than "the climate crisis" I'd be ashamed to be so gullible.   This is all about separating the lame-brained,  the superstitious, the malleable, the dis-educated, the weak-willed, the totally indoctrinated  from their liberty and their cash (if they ever had the mettle to acquire any)    The billionaires in corporate monopolies and their bought politicians  are rubbing their greasy palms over your stupidity.  

"Climate" isn't even a scientific term and the tell is that there are no metrics for "climate." This means that It cannot be measured any more than "a lot" or "a little" can.   Climate is purposely vague.  The desert has a hot dry climate or the rain forest has a warm moist climate are useful phrases.  The climate is "changing" is hogwash.    There is no such thing as "the climate" anymore than there is "the opinion" Opinions are like assholes, everybody has one, likewise their climates.  "The" opinion is changing?  WTF?   The "opinion crisis?"   How many climates exist?  How many are changing?  How many are getting "better" how many "worse?"

When does a climate period begin?  when does it end?  How long is a period?  How many climate periods are their in 100 years, 1000 years a million years?   How many are changing one direction and how many are changing in the opposite direction?  How many have no discernible change?  How can it be measured.  How many points does a hailstorm get?  How many points does a pleasant warm sunny day get?   Which is better: colder or warmer?    Wetter,or drier?  Are storms good or bad?  

The formula is embarrassingly simple and fit only for simple minds: If misfortune befalls anyone its the naughty climate that's at fault.  If you are assaulted  by gang-banging "teens"  its all on account of "the climate crisis"  

God what insufferable fools, when you outnumber us the Republic is gone, shot to hell. Talk about circular firing squads.

text:
Wait till the oil industry is 90% bio fuel. Less water for farming, Farmland prices increasing and even more mono-culture. A real environmentalists nightmare. I went Vegan 17 years ago hoping to feel better about what was happening to the world and the environment. I never thought it would ever start to catch on in a big way. To my surprise it has started to take off a little but just the other day i realised how sad the situation really is. Oil is becoming too difficult and too expensive to extract and the energy giants are already well into the switchover to biofuels. It's happening slowly and seemingly silently right in front of our faces but we won;t really realise how destructive it will become for many more decades. And how sad is it that half of the people turning vegan are doing it hoping to help the restoration of nature. But the sick reality is that by becoming vegan we are actually facilitating the freeing up of land to allow the production of biofuel by way of intensive mono-culture farming.
  The sad thing is that we will need more fuel than ever before over the next 40 years. As the world population stabilises the developing world will also become the new No. 1 consumer by far, since they represent a much larger percentage of the worlds population than the western world does.
  I knew it was too good to be true when i saw everyone starting to go vegan. The only hope we really have to restore nature is to drop the capitalistic system and take a step back into community and family life. It will take huge sacrifices but the consequences will eventually be horrific

text:
¬†@Ki√™n Ng¬† 
Sea level on average is up about 400 feet over the last 15,000 years as the continental glaciers receded from the Asian, European, and North American land masses.     My driveway was once under a glacier over 2 km thick.   It's now gone, thank God.    This is what is called "climate change" and nothing the criminal socialists can do can stop it or control it. 

Inter-generational "Climate change" is no longer occurring and sea levels are not rising globally.    Anything short of 200 years is just "weather" 
    

In fact, the seas are receding in many areas of Northern Europe.   This has nothing to do with what men and women are doing to keep warm and to grow and eat food.  
     

Sea levels today are just a local thing as plate tectonics cause certain landmasses to bob up and down on the earths semi-molten mantle.  Other causes are:  wind and wave erosion; urban land subsidence as water tables are pumped down; and local street flooding due to poor urban planning.  

These things are often scammed as "climate change" but its only just more socialist bullshit. 

There is no way to interpret minor sea level changes on a global scale as the continents are moving on the Earth's Mantle at rates that are 10 times greater than minor episodic local sea level change.


You have been scammed by crooked politicians and the fake education you have received by your local propaganda machine that you laughingly refer to as "your education"


Sure, and Yes,  Santa Claus is real too.   I would think you might be ashamed of the level of ignorance you so willingly swallow lock, stock, and barrel.

text:
¬†@Stormy Sampson¬† I don't think you understand satire.    Let me help you out here:

Satire, definition: "the use of humor, irony, exaggeration, or ridicule to expose and criticize people's stupidity or vices, particularly in the context of contemporary politics and other topical issues."

Here is an example:

"no change is visible? You must be a denier. Get with the program. I live 1400 feet above sea level and ocean waves are lapping at my door"

And here is my satirical response to this satire:

"Its far worse than that, the streets of Denver are often underwater  and it's a full mile above sea level !" 

You see, the Bolsheviks who push this scam point to street flooding in Miami as being caused by lack of sufficient taxes on energy (the most regressive tax of any yet invented.)

So my response satirically points out that street flooding that is as  a continuing problem in Denver, like that in Miami, therefore MUST also be caused by the Atlantic (or Pacific, take your pick) Ocean rolling over the streets of Denver (the Mile High City).

This  is what satire looks like.  

(Street flooding in Miami like that of Denver is caused by poor urban planning)

author: Alek Damyanov

text: ¬†@Kent Horvath¬† that really makes no difference, if anything it may make it harder for you to see the difference. Research sea level rise to get an idea of what I'm talking about. Scientists are not lying, no motivation to do so. It's difficult to see the difference when sea level has only risen by 3 inches in the past 30 years. The issue is that due to the accelerating warming of the planet the levels will continue to rise at an even faster rate as the trend has been so far.. Look into the King Tide Photo Project, you can even participate in it. This is going to be sure proof of sea level rise. When I arrived at the coast on December 21st 2019 I seriously couldn't believe what I was seeing, I felt fear for the people living there just looking at the areas next to the water. King tide is used a marker that shows what to expect during the next 12 months.
author: Alek Damyanov

text: ¬†@Kent Horvath¬† also research the first victim of climate change - the island of Kiribati. The people living there have only a few years left before everyone will need to evacuate or be swallowed by the ocean.

text:
Chapter 7 contains Jefferson's observations on the climate of Virginia, including local warming:- the year 1801

"A change in our climate however is taking place very sensibly. Both heats and colds are become much more moderate within the memory even of the middle-aged. Snows are less frequent and less deep. They do not often lie, below the mountains, more than one, two, or three days, and very rarely a week. They are remembered to have been formerly frequent, deep, and of long continuance. The elderly inform me the earth used to be covered with snow about three months in every year. The rivers, which then seldom failed to freeze over in the course of the winter, scarcely ever do so now. This change has produced an unfortunate fluctuation between heat and cold, in the spring of the year, which is very fatal to fruits. From the year 1741 to 1769, an interval of twenty-eight years, there was no instance of fruit killed by the frost in the neighbourhood of Monticello. An intense cold, produced by constant snows, kept the buds locked up till the sun could obtain, in the spring of the year, so fixed an ascendency as to dissolve those snows, and protect the buds, during their developement, from every danger of returning cold. The accumulated snows of the winter remaining to be dissolved all together in the spring, produced those overflowings of our rivers, so frequent then, and so rare now."

¬† In 1816 winters had become so cold¬† snow never melted one summer, and remained harsh and cold until 1850,¬† when warming began.

text:
Climate change is the current pretext to justify halting use of the land resource. Building upwards and ceasing expansion outwards causes home prices to skyrocket and places the lifetime earnings of citizens extracted through rent squarely into the hands of the International Socialists. Within a generation a nation is turned into a vassal. 

A similar campaign half a century ago employing agricultural land as the pretext caused home prices to launch from the ten thousand dollar to the million dollar level pricing homes beyond reach while simultaneously making million dollar an acre land unfeasible to farm.

Organized protest, including pleas from children, attends each attempted use of land.

Each time another tract of land is ‚Äúprotected‚Äù the public cheers. Those most affected tighten the snare on their own demise. Thousands of homeless in each city. 

All of the land on this planet was promised to the chosen few, together with the increase that it yields. It is being redeemed.


Footnotes:

Preserving farmland inspired a movement to protect all land from development instead of making forestland that we have in extravagant abundance available for housing. This restriction caused farmland values to skyrocket making it uneconomical to till. Homes that were $10,000 to $60,000 with the average price ranging from $10,000 in most cities to $24,000 in the more expensive regions rose to multi-millions as a result of the artificially created shortage. A mile width of forestland over a short distance near cities would eliminate the housing issue permanently. We have thousands of miles of forest. Saving a forest is ill-conceived. Nature ignores man‚Äôs declarations and continues on its usual course of cleansing by fire the forest of its dead, dying and diseased to make way for new growth, as it has been doing since time immemorial. 

A generation prevented from acquiring a home and becoming established lives for experience that soon devolves to escape by taking drugs.

Citizens whose income enabled them to purchase a ten thousand dollar home with a value that now exceeds a million dollars are doomed. Their home must be sold to cover deferred property taxes and to repay loans secured by equity upon winding-up of their estate. The freedom that derives from owning your own home is ending.

Civic governments reap a bonanza from property assessments generating billion dollar surpluses. This is ‚Äúinvested‚Äù in the equivalent of municipals that return $3 in forty years time for each $100 spent on acquiring them now. Young people work two shifts daily in order to keep a roof over their heads, one that they will never own. A third of the world away a hill of sand is transformed into a metropolis.

text:
¬†@R. Jones¬†  Sea Level is rising at 6 inches per century which is normal for the earth coming out of a cool period. According to the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (see page 3 of the 2013 Summary Report), averaged over all land and ocean surfaces, over the 132 years between 1880 and 2012, earth temperature has warmed 1.53 degrees Fahrenheit (0.85 degrees Celsius). This rate of temperature change is within the normal range of historic temperature changes which naturally occurred before humans started burning fossil fuel, so the man-made global warming theory fails at the first stage of evidence.

Global Warmists have failed to show any causal correlation between historic or current atmospheric CO2 concentrations and Earth Temperature.  Earth's atmosphere has 0.04% CO2 and there is no evidence that CO2 is a so-called "greenhouse gas", that's why you can't show an correlation between current or historic atmospheric CO2 concentrations and earth temperature.

Atmospheric CO2 concentrations are presently 0.04% which is only one hundredth of the concentration at which CO2 starts to become harmful to humans.  CO2 is not pollution, CO2 essential for verdant abundance of planet Earth. We need more CO2 in the atmosphere. text:
¬†@Phiip Woodgate¬†   You think 1.5 degrees is fast? How many times have scientists ever measured a one hundred year period over the millions of years? Never perhaps? Co2 emissions have been rising exponentially since the 1800's. Temps have barely moved. Sea levels have been rising linear for at least 200 years at only about 3mm per year. Why no correlation with Co2? 

For 10,000 years glaciers have been melting. As they melt, the earth becomes less reflective. This causes temps to rise and speed up. Glaciers begin to melt faster. Melt, speed up, melt more, speed up more. This gives you a rising curve in the temp graph. 

On top of that 7.5 billion people exhale Co2 every second instead of only 1 billion people back in the 1800's. That's 7.5 times more Co2 just from human breathing. We are also paving the entire planet and cutting down every Co2 sucking jungle and forest on the planet. Way less Co2 being extracted. 

Cities are far warmer and heat absorbent.  I live in Toronto. We sit by Lake Ontario. On any given summer day it is 5 degrees cooler by the lake than in the heart of the city. How many cities existed 200 years ago? Satellites now measure temps almost every sq foot of the ground. What happens when these satellites measure the temp emanating from these kinds of cities? You think that might affect the average?  Nobody is considering any of this.

text:
Climate
change is caused locally and felt globally. In relation to the case study of
Africa, the main driver of climate change in that region is its own population,
that still relies on very primitive landscape management techniques, such as
chop-and-burn. This reduces tree cover, negatively affecting the water balance of
the entire region. Forests have a climatic role not only regarding carbon
sequestration. They provide shade, and thus reduce temperatures and increase
moisture at local level. The application of better landscape management techniques
would allow the tree cover to increase through natural regrowth and sustainable
forest management techniques, such as forest enrichment, that could also
provide the population with food, shelter and fuel. The economic factor can
never be despised in the efforts to increase the forest area globally, to
tackle climate change.

text:
¬†@Ricardo Maccotta¬†  Good points. The problem is the climate movement has embraced hysteria. The hard core leftists and environmental zealots are drowning out the scientists. They also demonstrate considerable hypocrisy. Do you have any idea of the environmental impact of a climate summit? No scientist is claiming this to be apocalyptic. Any message, whether accurate or inaccurate, that is spread with such reinforcing fear simply becomes the truth. When you repeat something often enough it becomes the truth. 

Do you realize that the latest media frenzy regarding the recent statement from a so called group of 11,000 scientists has already been proven to be fake. A blogger invented the name - The Alliance of Scientists - the claims have not risen from a research paper, it was nothing more than an opinion piece. It was put up on this Alliance web site, and if you agreed with the statements you were invited to click on a link that signed your name to the document. It was no better than "liking" something on someone's Facebook page. A study of the names and occupations revealed that these were just ordinary people not scientists. They were accountants, Lawyers, administrators, analysts. Most were activists and artists. They have even discovered fake entries like Micky Mouse, and other such nonsense. But the media ran with it and reinforced into everybody's heads about this climate emergency. People are not hearing differing perspectives because dissent of any kind is demonised. This is an authoritarian tactic. 

In the 1970's real actual scientists were predicting an ice age, based on a serious drop in the temp graph from the 1930's onward. There were numerous books out about the impending planetary starvation. One of these books, no doubt in today's bargain bins, was written by the co-founder of extinction rebellion. Geologists claimed we were running out of oil. Humans have met a myriad of challenges. We are innovative and creative. Fear mongering solves nothing. An endless stream of dire predictions have not come to pass.
author: Anthony Morris

Soil and water are universal instruments of labor and are the subject of a labor-process changing soil into corn, a river into drinking water.

text:
The US is not immune and neither is Europe. When the people of Italy, Spain, Greece, Portugal and Trukey begin moving northwards we will already have seen huge strains on our global food supply. The loss of trees in the US, the abstraction of the Ogalala reservoir, the loss of large areas of Florida and Louisana and the drying out of land west of 100 degrees latitude will see huge migrations. The drying out of Latin America will see more migrations while extreme weather such as unseasonal cold weather and droughts from the fluctuating jetstream will see crop yields declline. 


The best way to treat them like family is to get off fossil fuels as quick as possible and dramaticly reduce our consumption, meat eating, flying and driving.


The film talks about the 120 day rule where the soil needs to be moist for at least a120 days to grow grain. Having spoken to a number of climate refugees when temperatures hit the mid 40s (Celsius) for 2 weeks or more the crops fail. We are already seeing these temperatures in Europe, Australia and the US, these heatwaves and droughts will  inevitably get longer.


Europe has over 1,000,000 refugees from the Syrian crisis, largely due to a drought between 2006 and 2011 which destroyed 80% of crops and livestock.


Migration is adaptation of last resort, to leave ones home land and community is akin to grief and the extinction of ones culture. The west has not even began mitigating climating change never mind adapting and still western leaders drag their feet when it comes to action on climate change and continue to explore for more fossil fuels.  Adaptation will be little more than panic management on a grand scale. 


As Nikita Zimov said at 20:00 mins: "You can write any apocolyptic scenarios you like and probably most of them will come true."

text:
There is now irrefutable proof that wireless technology specifically cell phone technology is directly  impacting global insect and bird populations. 

Insects play a critical role in the life process of the planet. 

All insects and most birds rely on the earth's magnetic field for navigation. 

The 75% collapse in global insect biomass over the past two decades is the single biggest existential threat to mankind since the nuclear age.

Apart from wireless devices (cell phone towers and cell phones and other wireless Internet broadcast devices) interfering with insect navigation there is now significant evidence that the decline is related to the build up of electromagnetic radiation in most airborne species. 

The increase in the frequency spectrum usage and exponential growth of the wireless industry and device usage correlates directly to sudden and dramatic  worldwide population decline. 

The impact of insecticides has been factored into these studies and whilst they are a major contributing factor their impact has been more linear than exponetial in terms of yoy population decline. Insecticides whilst a contributing factor are therefore not the root cause of the recent dramatic  collapse. There are many other contributing factors obviously but none which individually can explain such a negative effect.

Time to rethink our ever increasing use of wireless technology.

There have been many research studies that cover various insect species - but most get moved offline as fast as they are put up. Many researchers are scared to publish papers online that challenge the worldwide wireless  communications industry - it's worth $trillions! There's a lot of risk involved.

text:
This goes way beyond cell phone usage. The federal control agency NTIA and FCC in the US along with numerous other regulatory agencies around the world have a group of scientists who advise them on 'undue risk' to the public - it's a frequency spectrum balancing act - if the benefits outweigh the strategic risk then they generally give the go ahead with certain restrictions. 

The military for example have use of some very dangerous technology - in the microwave spectrum - that is known to be harmful to us human beings at certain ranges. In other words many governmental  organization's knowingly make use of technology that is harmful to the environment and living organisms including us because the strategic benefits outweigh the risk. Radiation poisoning  is a gradual process especially if the organism is large enough not to notice the effects in the short term.

Consider how deadly these technologies are to all less resilient life forms - including plants, birds, insects etc. 

We have been ramping up wireless technology usage exponentially since the computer age with little global regulation and long term global due diligence. 

According to the numerous studies on insect biomass the exponential decline started approximately 3 decades ago - but warning bells only started sounding in the last 15 years! Its the same with bird population decline and plants etc. It's very difficult to coordinate multi species global research - how can you be sure the researchers are all unbiased for example. Wireless technology is a major contributing factor but not the only cause of this catastrophe. 

Isolating cause and effect is very difficult. 

There needs to be a global authority that immediately  addresses / restricts and outlaws the usage of most of the frequency spectrum currently in use in both civilian and military applications. 

That's not a simple task! The fact is we really don't fully understand the global importance of insects and birds in the life process on a planetary scale - they might for example be far more Important than we initially realised perhaps even a major factor in global warming. We may never know.

MARK:  Look at the Sunny Day Floods in Florida and Virginia.  It's Sea Level Rise, no matter what the Deniers say.
I lived in NYC when Hurricane Sandy hit in 2012.  In 2012, the Sea Level in NY Harbor was 12 inches over the Level in 1912 (the year my Dad was born).
When Sandy hit, it caused more damage, since the water was at a higher level to begin with.   It flooded the subways, and the restaurant my Friend had in Red Hook, Brooklyn.
But don't worry:  On Oct 15, 2018, President Trump told 60 Minutes' Leslie Stahl that he believed Climate Change was real (and not a Hoax), but was not convinced that Humans were the cause. We are exposed to all of the kinds of radiation found in spent fuel in our daily lives. This includes alpha beta and gamma radiation.    Do you have a smoke detector in your house?   It contains americium, an alpha particle emitter, with a half life of 430 years - when it decays it forms several radioactive elements each with its own half life.  

Your body is radioactive with Potassium-40 (half-life 1.32 billion years) it is a both a -beta and +beta emitter.  Your body also contains Carbon-14 (half life 5,730 years) another alpha emitter.

How are you going to handle your own nuclear waste products?

text:
Low carbon. Smart city design.  Smile with joy & be inspired. SEE WHAT WE CAN DO..
https://youtu.be/xi6r3hZe5Tg
Smart design is a natural response to movement in human population. Opportunity & Innovation rather than crisis. I think Singapore provides a great model for how we can accomodate both growth and the movement of people. The change in climate isn't the end of the world. But it does ask us to design for the future. We will need to consider energy and natural habitat along with people. Up to 2 billion people will likely relocate over the next 30 years. I like Singapore because the design accomodates what is needed. There are already projections of where populations will be moving. This provides the world a opportunity to design, integrate & educate large numbers of people who have lagged behind in the development process.  If we Do This Right it's possible climate change will bring opportunity and better way of life to people who were largely disenfranchised before. I have a list of dreams for the future. Clean renewable energy, distribution, storage, vertical agriculture as we see in Singapore. Plus using vertical agriculture to help us regain habitat space. I have no doubt we can make this happen in ways that will benefit the coming generations.  My background is solar and while I'm not in engineering I definitely see the positive potential. Let's Get It Done :)

text:
Storms, floods, and earthquakes are indeed a part of the present world. We sometimes call them ‚Äúnatural disasters,‚Äù but they are not a surprise to God. Yes, God certainly can control the weather and send deadly storms.
Some have concluded that suffering occurs because it is beyond God‚Äôs control. This is incorrect. God has indeed established certain laws and principles that govern nature, but he remains sovereign over these laws. Psalm 148:8 declares that storms ‚Äúdo his bidding.‚Äù Concerning Jonah, it was the Lord who ‚Äúsent out a great wind into the sea, and there was a mighty tempest in the sea‚Äù (Jonah 1:4 KJV).
Old Testament writers did not hesitate to attribute the forces of nature to God: ‚Äúthy waterspouts ‚Ä¶ thy waves ‚Ä¶ thy billows‚Äù (Psalm 42:7 KJV). Today, God‚Äôs creation is too often depersonalized. He is in control, and has His reasons for all kinds of weather, both fair and stormy. 
Job‚Äôs family killed by a severe storm
One biblical example is the story of Job. Severe weather had killed Job‚Äôs sheep, his servants, and all 10 of his children.
As Job suffered further physical affliction, he asked, ‚ÄúWhy is there evil in the world?‚Äù His friends were not of great help in answering the question.
Finally, after much dialog, God spoke directly to Job out of a whirlwind (Job 38-41). The Lord made clear that His control over nature and His ultimate purposes are to be trusted. We simply cannot understand all the details of the Divine plan.

text:
North Jakarta, Indonesia, a port city, has sunk 2.5 meters (almost 8 feet)  in 10 years and continues to sink by as much as 25cm a year in some parts, more than double the global average for coastal megacities. According to a media report, Jakarta is sinking by an average of 1-15cm a year and almost half the city now sits below sea level.

Not just the north part, the rest of Jakarta is sinking too, even if at a slower rate. The report says that in West Jakarta, the ground is sinking by as much as 15cm annually, by 10cm annually in the east, 2 cm in Central Jakarta and just 1cm in South Jakarta.

Other areas are similarly effected.The reason for this is two-fold - Tectonic Plate movement and Groundwater exploitation (too much being taken out and not enough going back in)

I have yet to find a Global Warming Supporting story that mentions this when they quote the same numbers and blame it all on Global warming. This is why people have such a hard time believing such stories. They ALWAYS get important facts wrong.
author: Armastat

text:
Guys, the video hardly blamed developed nations for environmental catastrophes as a whole. Climate change is real and natural, however, humans did contribute to its accelerations. In the future, it is going to accelerate more (not because of humans anymore but because of all the reasons explained such as melting permafrost).

Whatever the case, climate change (A REAL PHENOMENON) will drive several hundreds of millions of people to migration! Imagine the entire population of USA needing to relocate. the way forward is to find solutions for the future. What to do with all the migrants and how to relocate entire cities and infrastructure. Even places like New York won't be safe.

In my country, Bangladesh, over 30 million people are going to get displaced from the South (Bay of Bengal region) within this century, basically within my lifetime. The government needs to find ways to build new cities in the central and north of the country. Most people don't perceive it now but in 20 years the situation is going to get critical. By that time it would already be too late and probably half the people with die of starvation and malnutrition.Probably even illness.

text:
DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH.   Nothing that's been proposed by the IPCC has any hope of changing the outcome predicted in this documentary, even based on the IPCC's own reports.  We need to de-fund the IPCC and reallocate the $ and brainpower to the rapid commercialization of Molten Salt Thorium Reactors (MSTRs).  They are extremely safe and produce very little nuclear waste.  The waste they do produce has a short half life, so it can be safely and economically stored.  MSTRs don't produce CO2, don't produce usable amounts of weapons grade fissile material,  and once commercialized they should produce electricity at lower costs than any technology other than hydro-electric.  If you factor in the huge, hidden cost in $ and net CO2, of millions of acres of trees lost to reservoirs, MSTRs are even more economically and environmentally cost effective than hydro, and the capital cost should be much lower once they are commercialized.  

Commercial MSTRs will be modular so they can be produced in on a production line basis, to lower capital cost and increase supply.  They can be operated safely on smaller scales than most other energy generation systems, so theycan be more distributed, reducing the cost of transmission infrastructure, and allowing generation even in remote locations.   They do not require large amounts of water for cooling.  MSTRs are inherently more thermodynamically efficient than most other fuel-based, electrical generation technologies, and waste heat from the reactor can be used to desalinate/purify water.   Even the most conservative estimates of readily available thorium put the supply at 10s of thousands of years based on increasing consumption to allow everyone on earth to use the same energy per capita as the US.  Accessing less readily available reserves produce estimates of a million years plus.

With lots of power to move earth, making concrete, and pumping water become easier AND will have little to no environmental impact.  Do your own research.  Understand the advantages of MSTRs, and, based on that research, you agree that MSTR's are the best hope for the future, do your part and push for the rapid governmental approval and commercialization of the technology.

text: Chock full of unsuppoted, unsubstantiated, and wildly false claims.  Really slick adumentary.  Not for the literate or wide awake individual who may have a basic clue about thermodynamics, solar dynamics, and cosmogenic forcings and cyclicity of weather and climate.  WWF Kabal  (A "Queen and Pope Production", paid advertisement).  I dislike this video, even though it is professiobally done.  UAH (University of Alabama in Huntsville) has a satellite dataset for global atmospheric temperatures on the decline since 2016.  The Atlantic Ocean at Disko Bay has been cooling since 2016, the NAO.  The Jakobshavn Glacier in Greenland has been expanding since 2016.  We have been in the Solar Minimum of Solar Cycle 24 since 2016.  We have had record snow levels in North America for the last several years.  The Oroville Dam is at Record Levels in 2019.  There is nothing presented here that would draw a thinking person to cobclude that the Earth is getting hotter from the period of 2016 to 2019; quite the opposite seems to be a more valid, scientific conclusion.

text:
I remember when we were told in the 70's with just as much certainty, with just as much proof, by just as many experts that we were heading for an ice age, anybody who thought different was a fool. And they had better scientists then, they could even land men on the Moon!
We haven't got a clue what the future holds regarding climate, it is out of our hands, unless you count tinkering with the 0.5% ( a high estimate) of the total greenhouse gasses caused by humans to make any difference to an ever changing climate. We do however have control over how we are poisoning the Earth with real pollution.
To quote H L Mencken, someone who knew his stuff, 
The whole aim of practical politics is to keep the public in a state of alarm, and thus clamorous to be led to safety, by menacing them with an endless series of hobgoblins, all of which are imaginary.
The hobgoblin of the moment is climate change.
And the safety which they are herding us towards is called digital inclusion, small steps at first, like suggesting that smart meters might help with climate change, and ending up with us all being microchipped- for our own good of course.

text: ¬†@Les Schorlemer¬† Hi Les , I'd like to discuss some of your temperatures. The 150 year increase. Just about everyone agrees with that on both sides of the argument. It shows the recovery from the Little Ice Age which spanned the Maunder and Dalton Grand Solar minimums. Some of the graphs today no longer show the warm period in the 1930's and NASA has been called out on this. The temperatures were adjusted downward. Anyway here we have a global warming trend which started way before the massive industrialization and way before the rise in CO2. I take exception to your comment that it is warmer now than a thousand years ago which was the medieval warming period and the 10,000 year ago claim that it has warmed since. 10,000 years ago is the beginning of the Holocene Optima which was a couple degrees warmer today. Ever since the Optima the temperature would decrease and increase several times until the present but each time it doesn't get quite as warm. Comparing this inter glacial period to the three previous you will also see each one is progressively cooler. Solar activity is showing that we are now in the Eddy Grand Solar Minimum and it will last for the next 30 years or longer. The danger is crop failure and we are already seeing that happen now.
author: Roy Oetting

text:
¬†@Roy Oetting¬† Hi Roy, thanks for the respectful reply.  Hard to find people willing to have this discussion nowadays without things devolving into mud slinging...

Sorry for the lengthy reply but bear with me and read all of it. Hopefully it makes sense by the end (Based on your comment I'm replying to I think it will) :-) 

Man made climate change isn't about hot cold hot cold. I mean it sort of is, but man made climate change is more about ocean level rise over the next 10,000 years or so, and what we can do to help prevent it. 

We are DESTINED to be in another ice age in the next 10-15,000 years or so (estimates on when that is still vary to some small degree)... Mankind will NEVER be able to stop that from happening. In other words NO amount of CO2 in the atmosphere seems likely to stop this from happening. 

BUT! CO2 levels WHILE we are in the interglacial period we are currently in CAN affect how high the ocean levels get between now and the next ice age. 

Today, more than half of the world's population lives on or within a hundred miles of the coastlines. Trillions of dollars of prime real estate will be sunk in the next few hundred to thousand years if we don't learn to try to curb our CO2 emissions. 

One thing is absolutely certain. IF we continue on the path we're on, sea levels WILL rise ~60 feet between now and the next ice age. Why 60 feet? Because we've calculated exactly how much ice there is on the earth today, and if it were to completely melt, over whatever time period you want to imagine, we can calculate exactly how high the ocean levels will go. 

At this point, with the amount of CO2 we've generated to date, SOME level of rise will take place (estimates and timelines involved vary, that's why we're trying to perfect the models) 

If we can learn to curb our CO2 emissions, or move completely off fossil fuels over to nuclear as a primary source of energy, MAYBE we can limit that rise to 5-10 feet, 20 feet, who knows... 

Wouldn't you like to try to, at the very least TRY to keep that from happening?

text:
Stop blaming corporations and industries, they are NOT burning fossil fuel for the sake of burning fuel. They burn fuel as energy source to manufacture all the products that we consume everyday. You want them to stop? Here's how: Stop buying their products and services.
But I can't live without their cheap mass production products, and I doubt you can either. Can you make your own soap, or shampoo, or weave your own clothing, or manufacture your own drugs, or even as simple as grow your own food? I doubt it. We can't even produce our basic necessity, let alone building our own smartphone, TV, or car.

We are addicted to fossil fuel, it is what makes our lifestyle possible. There's no way out of this unless we are all suddenly got tired of modern living standard and want to go back to a simpler life before industrial revolution, it's almost our fate to continue on and go through climate change.
I think as bad as climate change will be, it won't be as bad as life before industrial age.
